intro: Desmostachys planchonianus f. glabriflorus, commonly known as the smooth-flowered planchonian daisy, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The species is distinguished by its reduced leaf hairs and showy, yellow to orange ray florets. It typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky soils. The plant's morphology reflects adaptations to arid environments, with a compact growth form and efficient water conservation mechanisms.
